intro: Gagea nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra gagea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, rhizomatous stem and produces clusters of white or pale green flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Gagea nevadensis is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
